channel.title: BBC News - India
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Tamil Nadu: Chennai’s 'last Jew' fights for place in India’s history
item.description: Davvid Levi has been documenting the history of his family and that of other Jews in India's Chennai city.

item.title: Women take the lead in India’s Republic Day parade
item.description: Every year, the country celebrates the day its constitution came into effect with a grand spectacle.

item.title: India v England: Ollie Pope ton gives tourists hope in Hyderabad
item.description: Ollie Pope's magnificent century, his best innings for England, keeps the tourists alive after three days of the first Test against India in Hyderabad.

item.title: India calls Pakistan's claim of targeted killings 'false'
item.description: Islamabad on Thursday accused India of killing two of its citizens on its soil in 2023.

item.title: Umar Khalid: Indian activist languishes in jail without bail or trial
item.description: Umar Khalid, who was arrested three years ago for alleged involvement in riots, is still waiting for a trial.

item.title: Adani Ports: The Tamil Nadu villagers taking on a billionaire's port plan
item.description: Locals in 100 villages of Tamil Nadu state are fighting the expansion of a port owned by Gautam Adani.

item.title: Bopanna, 43, becomes oldest tennis world number one
item.description: Rohan Bopanna becomes the oldest tennis world number one aged 43 after he and Matthew Ebden reach the Australian Open doubles semi-finals.

item.title: Watch: Crowds at India's new Ram temple in Ayodhya day after opening
item.description: The grand temple dedicated to the Hindu God Ram was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday.

item.title: Ayodhya Ram Mandir: India PM Modi inaugurates Hindu temple on razed Babri mosque site
item.description: The rituals were led by PM Narendra Modi, while opposition leaders and some Hindu seers stayed away.

item.title: Sony calls off merger with India media giant Zee
item.description: Zee considers legal action after Sony ends the planned $10bn merger of the firms' Indian operations.

item.title: Watch: Indian PM Modi inaugurates temple in Ayodhya
item.description: The opening of the grand temple comes ahead of India's general elections.

item.title: India v Afghanistan: Two super overs as Rohit Sharma hits record century in T20 series win
item.description: Captain Rohit Sharma hits a record fifth T20 international century as India secure a 3-0 series win over Afghanistan after two super overs.

item.title: Man locked in SpiceJet plane toilet for over an hour
item.description: The passenger got stuck inside the lavatory of a SpiceJet flight after the door malfunctioned mid-journey.

item.title: Flight cancellations: Airport chaos angers Indians as fog hits travel
item.description: A man was arrested for slapping a pilot, while others were seen eating food on the Mumbai airport tarmac.

item.title: India v England: Relaxed, fit tourists look for series win for the ages
item.description: England's record in India is better than most, but merely staying competitive will be a fine achievement, writes Stephan Shemilt.

item.title: Ayodhya: Temple to open at India’s religious fault-line
item.description: The new temple in Ayodhya has stirred up memories for the community caught up in 1992's violence.

item.title: Kashmir's rare snowless winter sets off alarm bells
item.description: Experts say that the absence of snowfall this winter will lead to water scarcity and derail the economy.

item.title: Lakshadweep: Can India's 'alternative Maldives' handle mass tourism?
item.description: Indian PM Modi's recent visit to Lakshadweep could spark a tourist surge - but is the island chain ready?

item.title: Gujarat boat capsize victims 'not given life jackets'
item.description: Parents of students who died after a boat capsized in India's Gujarat state allege negligence by authorities.

item.title: What Rahul Gandhi's march means for India election
item.description: The Congress leader's cross-country march began with hope, but analysts doubt its electoral impact.

item.title: Agatha Christie: The Indian hotel murder that inspired the queen of crime
item.description: The sensational case, which made global headlines, is said to have influenced Christie's first book.

item.title: Bengaluru: Why English is dividing people in India's Silicon Valley
item.description: Kannada-language protesters recently hit the headlines for tearing down English billboards in Bengaluru.

item.title: Bihar men conned by 'impregnating women' job scam
item.description: Scammers in Bihar state promised to pay huge sums of money to men to get childless women pregnant.

item.title: Maldives: Maldivians debate India's 'boycott' of their nation
item.description: Tensions have escalated after three Maldivian ministers made derogatory comments about India's PM Modi.

item.title: Plane gets jammed under bridge in India
item.description: The scrap fuselage was on its way to Assam from Mumbai on a lorry when it got stuck.

item.title: Intruder jumps on table in Indian parliament
item.description: Lawmakers said two men jumped into the well of the house from the visitors' gallery.

item.title: Moment worker is pulled from collapsed tunnel
item.description: Fourty-one Indian workers are finally rescued from a tunnel that partially caved in after a landslide.

item.title: First video of trapped tunnel workers in India
item.description: Rescuers have shared a video of the 41 workers who have been trapped inside a tunnel since 12 November.

item.title: Andhra Pradesh: Drone footage shows aftermath of deadly India train crash
item.description: A preliminary investigation has found that "human error" led to the collision, officials say.

item.title: India flash floods: More than 100 missing in Sikkim state
item.description: Hundreds of search and rescue officers have been deployed across the state of Sikkim.
